0.speaker: Me
0.text: I worked on the 11th floor of an office building just a block from my subway stop.

1.speaker: Me
1.text: There was a nice cafe on the ground floor where I would sneak off to during lunch hours to check my messages and my feed.

2.speaker: Me
2.text: The office layout was about as mundane as it came. Cubicles everywhere, no friends to be made here.

3.speaker: Me
3.text: As I walked down the long aisle to my desk, I could see a few people ducking their heads over and then quickly below their cubicle walls.

4.speaker: Me
4.text: Yes, I have arrived, and I am late.

5.speaker: Me
5.text: As I seated myself at the desk, ensuring I plugged in my phone to the charger before I switched on anything else, I could hear the loud sounds of my boss's feet stomping towards me.

6.speaker: Boss
6.text: Hey! Where have you been all morning?

7.speaker: Me
7.text: 'Sorry boss, my alarm didn't go off, phone died.'

8.speaker: Boss
8.text: You can't keep doing this. First it was you fell asleep at your computer 'working.' Then it was you got 'lost' wandering outside, and now it's your phone.

9.speaker: Boss
9.text: You gotta stop making excuses and get to work on time like everybody else.

11.speaker: Boss
11.text: Now listen, that presentation is being bumped up to tomorrow, so I hope those documents you prepared are ready.

12.speaker: Me
12.text: I felt a lurch in my stomach. Of course they weren't ready!

13.speaker: Me
13.text: 'I was supposed to have all of this week to prepare...'

14.speaker: Boss
14.text: Well, you don't anymore. Get what you have to me by 5PM and we'll see how long you need to stay overtime today.

15.speaker: Me
15.text: I sat back in my seat, on the verge of just slamming something out of frustration at the unfairness of it all.

16.speaker: Me
16.text: But I didn't have time for that. There wasn't time for anything.
